name: Arrestor bed ahead
description: To indicate where especially drivers of heavy vehicles who become aware that a vehicle’s brakes became defective, can drive such a vehicle of the road and it will be stopped by the gravel section ahead.

name: Arrestor bed ahead
description: To indicate where especially drivers of heavy vehicles who become aware that a vehicle’s brakes became defective, can drive such a vehicle of the road and it will be stopped by the gravel section ahead.

name: No overtaking or no crossing line ahead
description: To warn you that there is a no-overtaking line or no-crossing line ahead.

name: Mandatory direction arrow ahead
description: To warn in time that you will be obliged to follow a certain direction at the first intersection.

name: Lane reduction arrows
description: To warn that the traffic lanes are reduced from the left or right or from both sides.

name: Yield control ahead
description: To warn that there is a yield sign ahead.

name: Reversible lane lines
description: To warn drivers that the lane indicated by this marking can be used for traffic from the opposite direction at various times of day or night.

name: Dividing lines
description: To warn that vehicles on the other side of the road marking are moving in the opposite direction.

name: Dividing lines
description: To warn that vehicles on the other side of the road marking are moving in the opposite direction.

name: Continuity lines
description: To warn you that there is a break (intersection or off ramp) in the continuing part of the roadway and to inform you that if you are in a lane that has a line on one side, that lane will soon turn off from the road which you are now travelling.

name: Continuity lines
description: To warn you that there is a break (intersection or off ramp) in the continuing part of the roadway and to inform you that if you are in a lane that has a line on one side, that lane will soon turn off from the road which you are now travelling.

name: Continuity lines
description: To warn you that there is a break (intersection or off ramp) in the continuing part of the roadway and to inform you that if you are in a lane that has a line on one side, that lane will soon turn off from the road which you are now travelling.

name: End of exclusive use lane arrows marking
description: Indicates that the exclusive use of the lane is about to come to an end.

name: End of exclusive use lane arrows marking
description: Indicates that the exclusive use of the lane is about to come to an end.

name: Speed hump
description: To warn that there is a speed hump in the road.

name: Railway crossing ahead
description: To warn that there is a railway crossing ahead.

name: Block pedestrian crossing
description: To inform you that priority must be given to pedestrians crossing or wanting to cross the road at these places.

name: Pedestrian crossing lines
description: To inform you that priority must be given to pedestrians crossing or wanting to cross the road at these places.

name: Yield line
description: To indicate that you must give priority to all who cross in front of you at this point.

name: Stop line
description: To indicate where you must bring your vehicle to a standstill.

name: Bus lane marking
description: To identify that part of the carriageway which is reserved for buses only during the periods indicated on the sign.

name: Mandatory direction arrows
description: To show that you may only proceed in the direction indicated by the arrow in your lane.

name: Exclusive parking bay
description: To identify parking only for road users identified by the symbol.

name: Parking bay
description: To indicate where you may park.

name: Painted island
description: To prohibit drivers from driving in this area.

name: Painted island
description: To prohibit drivers from driving in this area.

name: Painted island
description: To prohibit drivers from driving in this area.

name: Right-edge line marking
description: To indicate where the right-edge of the road is.

name: Left-edge line marking
description: To indicate where the left-edge of the road is.
